Description: Glazed steatite scarab, glaze faded to white; pierced longitudinally; engraved with details of head and legs and on the base with a scarab flanked on either side by a uzat eye, an ankh and a was sceptre; signs of magical significance, conveying blessings or expressions of royal power that do not translate into words.
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 245)
Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (98)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 1)
